content: भगः [भज्-घ] {@--1@} One of the twelve forms of the sun; the sun. {@--2@} The moon. {@--3@} A form of Śiva. {@--4@} Good fortune, luck, happy lot, happiness; आस्ते भग आसीनस्य Ait. Br.; भगमिंद्रश्च वायुश्च भगं सप्तर्षयो ददुः <ls>Y. 1. 282.</ls> {@--5@} Affluence, prosperity. {@--6@} Dignity, distinction. {@--7@} Fame, glory. {@--8@} Loveliness, beauty. {@--9@} Excellence, distinction. {@--10@} Love, affection. {@--11@} Amorous dalliance or sport, pleasure. {@--12@} The pudendum muliebre; <ls>Y. 3. 88</ls>; <ls>Ms. 9. 237.</ls> {@--13@} Virtue, morality, religious merit (धर्म). {@--14@} Effort, exertion. {@--15@} Absence of desire, indifference to worldly objects. {@--16@} Final beatitude. {@--17@} Strength. {@--18@} Omnipotence; (said to be {%<ab>n.</ab>%} also in the last 15 senses). {@--19@} <ab>N.</ab> of an Āditya presiding over love and marriage. {@--20@} Knowledge. {@--21@} Desire, wish. {@--22@} The superhuman power of becoming as small as an atom, one of the eight {%Siddhis%} or powers of Śiva; see अणिमन्. --गं {@--1@} The asterism called उत्तराफल्गुनी. {@--2@} The perinæum of males.
